intro: Erucaria rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate erucaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
